name: Sales, R&D, R&D-to-sales ratio, employment, and R&D-to-employment ratio for companies that performed or funded business R&D in the United States, by selected industry: 2021
description: Sales, R&D, R&D-to-sales ratio, employment, and R&D-to-employment ratio for companies that performed or funded business R&D in the United States, by selected industry: 2021

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_domestic_net_salesa_millions_
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of dollars, percent R&D intensity, and thousands of employees

variableMeasured.name: field_all_r_db_millions_
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of dollars, percent R&D intensity, and thousands of employees

variableMeasured.name: field_r_d_to_sales_ratioc_
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of dollars, percent R&D intensity, and thousands of employees

variableMeasured.name: field_domestic_employmentd_headcounts_in_thousands_total
variableMeasured.description: Domestic Employmentd Headcounts In Thousands Total
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of dollars, percent R&D intensity, and thousands of employees

variableMeasured.name: field_domestic_employmentd_headcounts_in_thousands_r_de
variableMeasured.description: Domestic Employmentd Headcounts In Thousands R De
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of dollars, percent R&D intensity, and thousands of employees

variableMeasured.name: field_r_d_to_employment_ratiof_
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of dollars, percent R&D intensity, and thousands of employees

notes: Data are for companies with 10 or more domestic employees. Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Industry classification was based on the dominant business code for domestic R&D performance, where available. For companies that did not report business codes, the classification used for sampling was assigned.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics and Census Bureau, Business Enterprise Research and Development Survey, 2021.
